sections.title: Introduction and Basics
sections.description: Fundamental concepts, measurements, and scientific methods in chemistry.

subtopics.title: Measurement of Physical Quantities
key_points: Measurement of mass, length, time, temperature and volume
Appropriate SI units and significant figures
Precision and accuracy in measurement
objectives: Measure physical quantities accurately using SI units
Understand precision and accuracy in scientific measurements

subtopics.title: Scientific Methods
key_points: Observation, hypothesis, experimentation, formulation of laws and theories
objectives: Outline and apply the scientific method in problem-solving

sections.title: Atomic Structure and Periodic Chemistry
sections.description: Structure of atoms, periodic table, and properties of elements.

subtopics.title: Gross Features of the Atom
key_points: Dalton's atomic theory and limitations
J.J. Thompson's experiment and Bohr's model
Rutherford's alpha scattering experiment
objectives: Describe historical models of the atom

subtopics.title: Atomic Number, Mass Number, Isotopes
key_points: Atomic number/proton number, number of neutrons, isotopes, atomic mass, mass number
Meaning and representation in symbols of atoms and sub-atomic particles
Relative atomic mass (Ar) and relative molecular mass (Mr) based on Carbon-12 scale
Atomic mass as weighted average of isotopes (e.g., chlorine)
Definition of atomic mass unit

subtopics.title: Characteristics and Nature of Matter
key_points: Atoms, molecules and ions
Particles as building blocks of matter
objectives: Differentiate between atoms, molecules, and ions

subtopics.title: Particulate Nature of Matter
key_points: Physical changes: melting of solids, magnetization of iron, dissolution of salt
Chemical changes: burning of wood, rusting of iron, decay of leaves
objectives: Distinguish between physical and chemical changes with examples

subtopics.title: Electron Configuration
key_points: Detailed electron configurations (s, p, d) for first thirty elements
Orbitals: origin of s, p, d as sub-energy levels; shapes of s and p
Rules: Aufbau Principle, Hund's Rule, Pauli Exclusion Principle
Abbreviated and detailed configurations in s, p, d
objectives: Apply rules for filling electrons in orbitals

subtopics.title: Classification of Mixtures
key_points: Solid-solid, solid-liquid, liquid-liquid, gas-gas with examples

subtopics.title: Separation Techniques
key_points: Crystallization, distillation, precipitation, magnetization, chromatography, sublimation

subtopics.title: Criteria for Purity
key_points: Boiling point for liquids, melting point for solids
objectives: Determine purity using boiling and melting points

subtopics.title: Periodicity of the Elements
key_points: Electron configurations leading to group and period classifications
objectives: Explain periodicity based on electron configurations

subtopics.title: Different Categories of Elements
key_points: Metals, semi-metals, non-metals, halogens
Alkali metals, alkaline earth metals, transition metals
objectives: Classify elements in the periodic table

subtopics.title: Periodic Law
key_points: Explanation of the periodic law
Trends: atomic size, ionic size, ionization energy, electron affinity, electronegativity
Discrepancies for Be, B, O, N

subtopics.title: Periodic Gradation in Third Period (Na - Ar)
key_points: Progression from metallic to non-metallic character
Ionic to covalent bonding in compounds
objectives: Explain gradation in properties across the period

subtopics.title: Reactions Between Acids and Metals, Oxides, Trioxocarbonates (IV)
key_points: Period three metals (Na, Mg, Al)
Period four metals (K, Ca)
Chemical equations
pH of solutions of metallic oxides and trioxocarbonates

subtopics.title: Periodic Gradation of Elements in Group Seven (Halogens: F, Cl, Br, I)
key_points: Recognition of group variations and anomalies
Physical states, melting and boiling points
Variable oxidation states
Redox properties, displacement reactions
Reaction with water and alkali (balanced equations)
objectives: Describe properties and reactions of halogens

subtopics.title: Elements of the First Transition Series (21Sc – 30Zn)
key_points: Electron configurations, physical properties, chemical reactivity
Physical: states, metallic, magnetic
Reactivity with air, water, acids; comparison with s-block (Li, Na, Be, Mg)
Other properties: variable oxidation states, coloured compounds, complex formation, catalytic abilities, paramagnetism, hardness
objectives: Compare transition metals with s-block elements

sections.title: Chemical Bonding and Stoichiometry
sections.description: Types of bonds, stoichiometry, and chemical reactions.

subtopics.title: Interatomic Bonding
key_points: Meaning of chemical bonding
Lewis dot structure for simple ionic and covalent compounds

subtopics.title: Formation of Ionic Bonds and Compounds
key_points: Formation of stable compounds from ions
Factors: ionization energy, electron affinity, electronegativity difference

subtopics.title: Properties of Ionic Compounds
key_points: Solubility in polar/non-polar solvents, electrical conductivity, hardness, melting point

subtopics.title: Formation of Covalent Bonds and Compounds

subtopics.title: Shapes of Molecular Compounds

subtopics.title: Intermolecular Bonding

objectives: Compare ionic, covalent, metallic, intermolecular bonds

key_points: Symbols of first 30 elements and common elements

subtopics.title: Empirical and Molecular Formulae
key_points: Calculations involving formulae, mass/volume relationships, stoichiometry, % composition

subtopics.title: Chemical Equations and IUPAC Names

subtopics.title: Mole Ratios

key_points: Concept of solution, solvent, solute

key_points: Mass (g dm-3), molar (mol dm-3) concentration

sections.title: States of Matter and Energy Changes
sections.description: Kinetic theory, gas laws, energy in chemical processes.

Use to explain melting, boiling, evaporation, dissolution, Brownian motion, diffusion

Randomness decreases from gas to liquid to solid

Brownian motion experiments: pollen in water, smoke, dusty room

subtopics.title: Liquids

subtopics.title: Vapour and Gases
key_points: Vapour, vapour pressure, saturated vapour pressure, boiling, evaporation

subtopics.title: Solids
key_points: Ionic, metallic, covalent network, molecular solids with examples

subtopics.title: Types and Structures
key_points: Relate properties to interatomic/intermolecular bonding

objectives: Explain solid properties based on bonding

subtopics.title: Structures, Properties and Uses of Diamond and Graphite

subtopics.title: Determination of Melting Points of Covalent Solids

sections.title: Acids, Bases, Salts and Solubility
sections.description: Properties, reactions, and solubility of substances.

subtopics.title: Structure of the Atom
key_points: Elementary treatment of mass spectrometer: principles, operations, use for isotopes, relative atomic/molecular masses
Wave nature of electrons
Quantum numbers importance
Nuclear chemistry: nucleons, nuclide
Types/nature of radiations: alpha, beta, gamma; charges, mass, penetrating power
Radioactivity: induced/stimulated, natural/artificial, detection by Geiger-Muller
Nuclear reactions: fission/fusion, balanced equations, electricity generation, atomic bombs
Effects/application: carbon dating, agriculture/medicine/industries, hazards
Factors affecting nuclide stability: binding energy, neutron-proton ratio, half-life; calculations

subtopics.title: Periodic Chemistry
key_points: Reactions between acids and metals/oxides/trioxocarbonates (IV): period 3 (Na, Mg, Al), period 4 (K, Ca), equations, pH
Acidic properties of non-metal oxides: carbon, nitrogen, sulphur, phosphorus, chlorine; pH of solutions, equations

Physical/chemical properties of period 3 elements/compounds: comparison of hydrides/oxides/hydroxides/chlorides, thermal stability of CO3^2-/NO3- of Li/Na/K/Mg/Ca, experiment compare Na2CO3/Li2CO3/CuSO4
Silicon: structures SiO2/CO2 account for differences, uses of silicon/compounds (ceramics, glass, silica gel, microchips)
Periodic gradation group 7 halogens: inter-atomic bond energies, hydrides/acid strength (Ka values), variable oxidation states
Bonding in complex compounds: ligands, central ions, examples (Cl-, F-, I-, NO3-, NH3, H2O, SO4^2-), formation, nomenclature [Fe(CN)6]^3-, [Cu(NH3)4]^2+, [Ag(NH3)2]+, [Cu(CN)4]^2-
Shapes of complex compounds: tetrahedral, square planar, octahedral e.g. [Fe(CN)6]^3-, [Cu(NH3)4]^2+, [Ag(NH3)2]+ [Cu(CN)4]^2-
Elements first transition series: reactivity with air/water/acids, comparison s-block

subtopics.title: Bond Energy
key_points: Explanation bond energy/dissociation energy, average value, differences, use in bond strength/energy content/enthalpy reaction, calculations summation in reactants/products

subtopics.title: Acids, Bases and Salts
key_points: Definitions: Bronsted-Lowry/Lewis, conjugate acid-base pair equilibrium
pH, pOH, pKw: Kw=[H+][OH-]=1.0x10^-14 mol2 dm-6, pH=-log[H3O+], pH/pOH measure acidity/alkalinity, pH scale, calculation [H+]/[OH-]/pH/pOH

Buffer solutions: qualitative definition, lab examples, preparation

subtopics.title: Acid Base Titrations

subtopics.title: Chemical Kinetics and Equilibrium Systems
key_points: Rate law/order reaction: deduction from data, relation rates/concentration zero/first/second order, graphical representation, half-life first order/significance, general rate law R=k[A]^x[B]^y
Rate determining step multi-step reaction
Equilibrium law mass action: mathematical expression K, constant at constant temp, relation Kp/Kc, calculation from data, difference homogeneous/heterogeneous

subtopics.title: Chemistry of Carbon Compounds
key_points: Separation/purification: solvent extraction, melting point determinations
Determination empirical/molecular formulae: detection N/S/halogens, estimation C/H/O

Cement/uses: sources raw materials, processes production, uses, environmental impact

topics.title: Section C - Nigeria, Sierra Leone, Liberia, The Gambia

subtopics.title: Non Metals and Their Compounds
key_points: Carbon: allotropes graphite/diamond/amorphous, structures/properties/uses, combustion
Coal: types anthracite/peat/lignite, destructive distillation/uses products
Coke: classification/uses, manufacture synthetic gas/uses
Oxides carbon: CO2 lab prep/properties/uses/test, CO properties/uses, trioxocarbonate (IV) salts properties (solubility/heat/dilute acid)/uses
Oxygen: lab/industrial prep, properties/uses, test, binary oxides acidic/basic/amphoteric/neutral
Hydrogen: lab prep, properties/uses, test

Water/solution: composition water, test, reference electrolysis acidified water, solvent, hardness causes/removal (advantages/disadvantages soft/hard), experiments compare hardness, treatment town supply
Halogens: redox properties, displacement one halogen another
Chlorine: lab prep, properties/reactions (variable oxidation states, water/alkali balanced equations)
